org.letras.psi.ipen
Interface IPenState

public interface IPenState

This interface specifies constants used as flags to determine a pen's state.

Version:
0.0.1
Author:
felix_h

Field Summary
static int DOWN
          Used to set the pen into state: DOWN.
static int EXCEPTION
          Used to set the pen into state: EXCEPTION.

          Used to set the pen into state: ON.
static int OUT_OF_REACH
          Used to set the pen into state OUT_OF_REACH.
static int UP
          Used to set the pen into state: UP.
 

Field Detail

OFF

static final int OFF
Used to set the pen into state: OFF.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ON

static final int ON
Used to set the pen into state: ON.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

UP

static final int UP
Used to set the pen into state: UP. Note that this state implies that the pen is also ON.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DOWN

static final int DOWN
Used to set the pen into state: DOWN. Note that this state implies that the pen is also ON.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

EXCEPTION

static final int EXCEPTION
Used to set the pen into state: EXCEPTION. Note that this state is used to define that the pen is probably in a state where auto-recovery is impossible. A user interface should inform the user when the pen is entering this state to allow manual recovery.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

OUT_OF_REACH

static final int OUT_OF_REACH
Used to set the pen into state OUT_OF_REACH. Note that this state implies that the pen is also ON. A pen in state OUT_OF_REACH can still be recovered when coming into reach again but some samples may be lost in between.

Depending on the pen model, the pen state while eventually change from state OUT_OF_REACH to state OFF or to state EXCEPTION.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
